metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3140 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If named is configured to use Response Policy Zones (RPZ) an error processing some rule types can lead to a condition where BIND will endlessly loop while handling a query. Affects BIND 9.9.10, 9.10.5, 9.11.0->9.11.1, 9.9.10-S1, 9.10.5-S1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.6
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.6
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.6
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.6
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.6
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.6

libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.6
